page.title: 01The Glen West of Dornoch
page.content: A small salmon River, the Evelix, runs across the block, NW to SE with thickly wooded ridge on sW bank and moorland to the w and N. Upriver, hills rise on each side and glen is dominaed by the hill, Creagan Astle (200m).Terrain is rough heathery moorland.Downstream strath widens to flat partly drained marshland. To NE the hill slopes up gradually to about 185m. Crofting townships of Rearquhar,Birichen and Fleuchary are on this slope. Astle is tiny community on S bank of river. scattered crofts are traditional in style, worked by local people. The crofters have sheep and cattle,grow barley,oats,turnips and potatoes, and cut hay. Many under 40 with young families , and hae other jobs as well as thei crofts. A forestry commission conifer plantation
